Case reference: 2014001130.CaseDesc: On April 30, 1972, the body of a young man was found in the Fraser River near Port Coquitlam, British Columbia. The pathologist described him as being “short and chubby” and noted that he had had extensive dental work. It is believed that he died several weeks before his remains were recovered.

Case reference: 2005006999.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1981, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 40 to 60 years, was recovered from the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. He was seen jumping from a Ferry Boat by witnesses on board. He was transferred to Toronto General Hospital where he died on August 7, 1981. Staining on his teeth suggests that he was a smoker.

Teeth: Visible Missing, All of his upper teeth are absent and he only has five anterior teeth in his lower jaw.

Shirt: Yellow, A dark yellow shirt with blue and red box stripes

Deformity: Left Leg, Left leg is shorter than his right leg and it is possible that he may have had to wear lifts
Nose, Appears to have been previously broken.
Scar: Left Leg, Scarring on his left outer thigh and lower leg, probable skin donor sites.
Pelvis, Scars on both inguinal (groin) areas, possibly from hernia repairs.

Case reference: 2016068940.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2016, Cory Lanteigne was reported missing by family members after having gone out for a short walk, and never returning. He was not dressed for the weather conditions at the time and was experiencing a mental health crisis. An extensive ground search was conducted by police in the area where he was last seen but failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2013000026.CaseDesc: John Antic's wife spoke with him at 11:00 a.m. on November 5, 2012 at a local Burlington mall. Mr. Antic left the mall wearing appropriate clothing for the weather. At approximately 7:30 p.m., Mrs. Antic received a phone call from a woman on behalf of Mr. Antic. She could hear her husband in the background saying he was eating dinner at a restaurant in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Mr. Antic's presence at the restaurant was confirmed. It is believed that he was on foot, and is familiar with public transportation. Mr. Antic has had no contact with his family or banking institutions since. There were no pre-existing medical, domestic or mental health issues.

Hair: Grey, Short, Short hair on sides and balding across top

Hat: Black, A black flat topped hat with a brim at front.  No markings.

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2020007648.CaseDesc: James Oshanek was last seen at the end of August 1991 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001849.CaseDesc: On August 14, 1974, Murphy Williams was last seen working in a labour camp located between Fort St. John and Dawson Creek in British Columbia. It was reported that Mr. Williams was exhibiting signs of distress and it is believed that he may have attempted to walk from the labour camp to Fort St. John.

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark
Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat

Case reference: 2016061964.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1976, an unidentified Caucasian man, believed to be between the ages of 55 to 60 years old, was found in an abandoned blue van near 21 Blackburn Avenue, Toronto. He was malnourished, very dirty and heavily infested with lice. Locals knew him to live under the bridge at the foot of Blackburn Ave for about 15 years and he was known to local children as old Billy. He was circumcised. His feet showed frostbite which had become infected.

Hair: Grey, Long, Frontal balding and a grey beard 3 inches long
Teeth: Visible Missing, He had a few scattered carious teeth

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.

Case reference: 2014002963.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, Nicholas Leonard was seen for the last time rowing a homemade kayak towards the north end of Lower Loon Lake in the town of Wabush, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2020011631.CaseDesc: On January 29, 1975, at approximately 8:30 am, Simon Wilson was seen for the last time as he left his home for school in Toronto, Ontario. Simon did not arrive at school.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton. Early the following morning, Amber made a post on social media, which she constantly used to communicate with family and friends. Her social media account had no further activity after this time. It is unknown when she left her residence, what she was last wearing or how she may have left. Amber did not have access to a vehicle and would typically use public transit to get around. She lived a high risk lifestyle and seemed despondent on the night she was last seen.

Case reference: 2012020162.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River near New Westminster.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, distinctive under bite, missing a number of teeth which would have resulted in a unique smile

Jewelry: Silver, Brown, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Swiss made watch, 4 diamond inserts, serial number 8564524
Shoes: Other, "Transit" brand burgundy shoes with brown laces
Shirt: Cotton, Beige, T-shirt "Fruit of the Loom" brand
Cotton, Grey, "Tip Top" brand golf shirt
Jacket: Cotton, Beige, "Colorado" brand fleece with grey stripes on the sleeves

Case reference: 2014001471.CaseDesc: Martin Gant had not been seen by his wife since November 27, 1961, when he destined to Corral, Chile in South America to install machinery in a cannery where he had a contract.

Case reference: 2005001999.CaseDesc: In September 1979, Norman Ritchie, was a passenger in a 16 foot cedar strip boat on Georgian Bay near Cove Island, when it capsized. Five victims were recovered, but Mr. Ritchie has never been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016034139.CaseDesc: Jessie Lobban has not been seen since June 16, 2016 when he left his residence at an unknown time. Jessie left behind his vehicle and his bicycle. This is out of character for him and his family is concerned.

Deformity: Left Little Finger, Tip bent inward
Right Little Finger, Tip bent inward

Case reference: 2014005958.CaseDesc: Dallas Broich was last seen at his residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on October 8, 2012. He was supposed to report for work in Fort McMurray, Alberta, the following day but never arrived. Dallas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005938.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Mashia Rezadoust was seen for the last time by her father in Toronto, Ontario. Mashia was taken to China by her mother, but has never returned.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2014004626.CaseDesc: In March of 1975, “Rocky” FIDDLER, 14 years old, was reported missing by his family when he failed to return home.  It was learned, as a result of the investigation, that he was last seen in July of 1975 at a Powwow at Thunderchild First Nation, Saskatchewan, which is approximately 1.5 hours from Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan.  Investigation and searches have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014005069.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2008, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Kien Hua was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Kien had told his friend that he was going to borrow his parents' car and was leaving town for a couple of days. On March 4, 2008, his parents' vehicle was found abandoned in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2012020013.CaseDesc: Angeline Pete was last seen on May 26, 2011 leaving her residence in North Vancouver, BC.  Miss Pete's disappearance is suspicious and foul play cannot be excluded.

Hair: Brown, Long, Dyed, Often dyes it

Case reference: 2006011999.CaseDesc: On November 8, 1972, Henry King and Vancel Mcleod left King's Fishing Camp on Lake Huron to travel by boat to Thessalon where they were to deliver fish.  They never arrived at the intended destination.

Scar: Left Thumb, 1/2 to 3/4 inch in length.

Case reference: 2014002814.CaseDesc: On December 17, 1983, Guy Turgeon was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Rosemont-La-Petite-Patrie District in Montreal, Quebec. He was despondent and suffered from mental health issues. Guy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 1998000820.CaseDesc: Tom Marsden was last seen at a bush party near Summit Lake north of the City of Prince George.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2014001128.CaseDesc: On June 12, 1991, the body of an unknown female was found floating in the Fraser River in New Westminster, BC.  She was observed on the water directly under the Patullo Bridge between the wharf and a fishing vessel called the "Sea Cap X". The female had been in the water for a prolonged period of time and may be of Aboriginal or Asian descent.

Belt: Leather, Blue, With a belt buckle
Jewelry: Gold, Hoop earrings in both ears
Gold, Cardinal brand wristwatch, right wrist

Scar: Right Wrist, 3 cm horizontal and 1 cm oblique

Case reference: 2017072253.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, Nadia Atwi was seen for the last time in Edmonton at approximately 6:30 in the morning.  Her abandoned vehicle was located in Rundle Park, Edmonton later the same day.

Case reference: 2018032776.CaseDesc: On Tuesday, June 12 2018, Christian Robinson was seen for the last time leaving his home in the 6th Line and Simcoe Rd. area in the Town of Bradford, Ontario.

Shirt: Grey, Golf, White and yellow pattern on the chest
Backpack: May have a backpack with unknown contents

Case reference: 2021014442.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, Phillip Jordan was seen for the last time by witnesses as he entered the water’s edge at Prospect Point, Niagara Falls in New York state. During the time of his disappearance, Phillip was despondent.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Black and white anchor

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length

Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2015059300.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., Tommy Chear was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Tommy had advised that he would be home later, but never returned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, Framed, Framed glasses

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2020051250.CaseDesc: On April 19, 1983, an unidentified woman died. Shortly before her death, she was observed in the Montreal, Quebec area.

Case reference: 2012020104.CaseDesc: On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Francis Albert-Cloutier was seen for the last time at his home located in Saint-Marc-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. His vehicle, a black 2001 Chrysler Intrepid was found on the following day by a passerby on an ATV trail in Saint-Amable, Quebec. No one has since seen or heard from Francis.

Jewelry: Gold, A ring with colored stone on each middle finger

Case reference: 2014006050.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2013, Mr. Patrice Mathieu was reported missing from his home in St-Joseph-de-Sorel. He was last seen the day before. Mr. Mathieu does not own a car, however he does have a driver's licence. Mr. Mathieu usually travels on foot. He is quiet and is, by nature, anxious and withdrawn.

Coat: Black, Mid-thigh length with a hood

Case reference: 2013000024.CaseDesc: Susan Dawson was living with, and working for, Terry Murphy for approximately 3 weeks prior to her disappearance. She was last seen in the late hours of November 12, 1985 at a gathering at Terry's house. On November 13, a blue car was seen in Terry's yard. On November 14, at approximately 11:55 a.m., a massive explosion occurred at Terry's residence. Terry's remains were found in the debris but there was no indication that Susan was in the house at the time of the explosion. Investigators suspect foul play, and that Terry had some involvement with Susan's disappearance.

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2001002010.CaseDesc: Stephanie was last seen at home.

Jacket: Green Orange and Yellow Plaid jacket
Skirt: Black and white stripped velvet skirt.

Case reference: 2014004476.CaseDesc: Gayebrella King was reported missing by her family on May 8, 1980. She was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in late August 1978.

Case reference: 2014005523.CaseDesc: In 1998, Chi Fong was seen for the last time by his mother in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018062802.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2000, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Yao Lin was seen for the last time at his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006013399.CaseDesc: Dustin Rhodes has been missing from the area of Timmins, Ontario since July 6, 1991.  He was last seen around 11:00 a.m. on that day near his cottage on Gibson Lake.  His truck was found at that location but Mr. Rhodes has not been seen since.

Pants: Cotton, Grey, Blue, Grey or blue work pants

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2016034244.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on October 31, 1981 about 7 kms east of Hinton, AB just off Highway #16. The individual did not have teeth and no dentures were found with the body.

Case reference: 2008003699.CaseDesc: Gary Anderson and his wife Dawn were camping and fishing on Kilburn Lake in Woodland Caribou Provincial Park.  Mr. Anderson went out fishing on the lake alone in his canoe and never returned. A search by land, water and air turned up only a fishing lure and a hat.

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston WALDNER was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Mr. WALDNER was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but Mr. WALDNER has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black

Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2018043211.CaseDesc: On December 18, 1995, at approximately 8:00am, Sukhia Budhram was seen for the last time when she moved out of her son’s apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Since then, Sukhia has not had any contact with her family.

Case reference: 2016030649.CaseDesc: Kean Luo was originally from Malaysia, but had moved to the United States to attend school and begin his career. On March 2, 2016 Mr. Luo moved to Winnipeg, Manitoba for work. Friends and family began to worry about Mr. Luo as they were unable to reach him for an extended period of time. However, on April 2, 2016, police spoke with Mr. Luo at a local hotel. Mr. Luo said that he was not feeling suicidal, but was feeling stressed and missing his family. He was last seen on April 2, 2016 on the Sergeant Thomas Cooper bridge with his vehicle parked on the shoulder of the highway. All cell phone and bank activity have ceased.

Case reference: 2014002239.CaseDesc: On the August 24, 1993, Cynthia-Ann Peddle, commonly known as Cindy Paddle, was seen for the last time in Sept-Îles, Quebec. There is a possibility that Cindy frequented the area of Vieux Quai in Sept-Îles before her disappearance.

Vest: Red, Pink, T-Shirt, Pink or red
Pants: Denim, Blue, Faded Jeans, thigh pockets

Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2006023099.CaseDesc: Gordon Zeigler was last seen on January 3, 1991, heading to a camp on Elizabeth Lake, Ontario by snowmobile. Although his snowmobile was located on Lake Nipigon, he was never found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2013000086.CaseDesc: On July 24, 1992, Ramsey Jason Seng was seen for the last time in the La Petite-Patrie district of Montréal, Quebec. He may be in Cambodia.

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2005001599.CaseDesc: Shawn Jones and Leslie Jones were seen on October 24, 1993. The two boys were hitchhiking from Cape Croker to Wiarton. They were dropped off in downtown Wiarton. Between October 26-28, 1993 Leslie Jones was seen with another male fitting the description of Shawn Jones. They were seen together at the Tim Hortons coffee shop in Owen Sound, Ontario. Shawn Jones was last seen on Berford Street in front of Pacific Hotel. Leslie Jones was last seen in front of the Tim Horton's restaurant on 9th East Street.

Case reference: 2012020652.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1995, at 3:38 p.m. this unknown male was the victim of a train accident. He may have been in Kamloops, BC, at Padova City Resorts Inc., as he was in possession of one of their T-shirts. His travelling partner stated that the unknown male had said his name was Brian and he was from Ontario. The unknown male was very conscious of his personal hygiene as he always wanted to be clean shaven and neat in his appearance.

Shirt: Grey, T-shirt underneath the blue shirt

Mark: Abdomen, May have been heavy at one time as stretch type marks

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last heard from by her family sometime between 1968 and 1972. She was living in Edmonton, but is thought to have possibly gone to Vancouver during this time.

Case reference: 2014002231.CaseDesc: Heinz Gamper went mountain climbing in Jasper National Park and did not show up for work when expected.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 2014005093.CaseDesc: Hooshang Imanpoorsaid was last seen on May 2, 2008. At that time, he was living in Brossard. He was reported missing by his family. Mr. Imanpoorsaid’s credit card was used at Dorval airport and the Netherlands in 2008. He is of Iranian descent.

Case reference: 2014003036.CaseDesc: Originally from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Regan Pace Ambrose is believed to have gone missing in Japan. After being recruited to work at a Japanese hospital, Miss Ambrose moved to Tokuyama, Yamaguchi, Japan. She was last seen on January 11, 1998 after finishing a shift at work. She was reportedly seen in the area of Mount Aso in Kumamoto, Kyushu Japan on January 10th, 1998. Japanese and Canadian authorities investigated; however, met with negative results.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2014005508.CaseDesc: In October 2010, Maxime Jacques left Winnipeg, Manitoba by bus to visit family in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. On October 30, 2010, Mr. Jacques never arrived at his destination and his family reported him as missing.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2013000144.CaseDesc: Robert Angelo Furgiuele from Sault Ste-Marie, Ontario was last seen in Squamish, British-Columbia in 1991. He was residing in Squamish with his girlfriend and his daughter. He was working in a grocery store at the time. He last spoke to his mother by telephone in 1991. He might have moved to Vancouver Island, British-Columbia in 1992.

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses

Case reference: 2014005582.CaseDesc: Lionel Joseph Daigle went missing from the New Direction Special Care home, located on the Westside of the City of Saint John. Mr. Daigle was last seen April 3, 2011. He is reported to have mental health issues and requires regular medication. The public is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force with any information concerning his whereabouts.

Jacket: Grey, Winter jacket, 3/4 length with hood
